title: Crystal Palace vs Manchester City, Premier League: latest score and live updates
text:
With the 3pm kick-offs freshly out of the way, it's onto the late game between Crystal Palace and Manchester City.

Not many people would have predicted the champions would have been eight points behind Liverpool after eight games played but that is where Pep Guardiola's team find themselves, while they are also down to fourth after both Leicester and Chelsea won today. With Liverpool not playing until tomorrow, against bitter rivals Manchester United no less, this evening's game is a chance for City to regain some ground.

Despite their stutters recently (hardly a crisis but by City's usual standards, not great), the team's stats still give cause for optimism if a fan. Ten out of the last 11 away league matches won, scored in 15 successive away league fixtures, plus 27 goals already this term in total Not to mention the assist machine that is Kevin de Bruyne.

Palace supporters, don't despair though. Clean sheets in three of their four league matches, 14 points so far this season (their second highest after eight Premier League games ever) and one defeat in their last eight home league matches. And there's also some interesting defensive news on the City team front...
description: Guardiola confirms his centre-back pairing is Fernandinho and Rodri.
